intro: Senecio malmstenii, commonly known as the Malmsten's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features slender stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
